sect2.title: Introduction to PPP
sect2.para: The PPP package contains the pppd daemon and the chat program. This is used for connecting to other machines; often for connecting to the Internet via a dial-up or PPPoE connection to an ISP.

sect2.title: Installation of PPP

note.para: PPP support must be compiled into the kernel or available as a kernel module.

sect2.para: Install PPP by running the following commands:

userinput.command: patch -Np1 -i ../ppp-&ppp-version;-nobpf-3.patch && ./configure && make ETCDIR=/etc/ppp && make ETCDIR=/etc/ppp install

sect3.title: Configuration Information
sect3.para: The PPP daemon requires very little configuration. The main trick is scripting the connection. This can be done either using the chat program which comes with this package or by using .

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The PPP package contains the chat, pppd, pppdump and pppstats programs.

sect3.title: chat
sect3.para: The chat program defines a conversational exchange between the computer and the modem. Its primary purpose is to establish the connection between the Point-to-Point Protocol Daemon (PPPD) and the remote's pppd process.

sect3.title: pppd
sect3.para: pppd is the Point to Point Protocol daemon.

sect3.title: pppdump
sect3.para: pppdump is used to convert PPP record files to a readable format.

sect3.title: pppstats
sect3.para: pppstats is used to print PPP statistics.
